content.question: Which of the following best describes an example of resource partitioning in an ecosystem?

choices.label: Two different bird species feed from the same oak tree; one eats acorns, and the other eats insects in the bark.
A tick uses a white-tailed deer as its host, consuming the deerâ€™s blood as food.
Two individuals from the same population of barn owls hunt for the same species of mouse during the night.
A mason bee pollinates a variety of flowers in a botanical garden.

content.answer: Two different bird species feed from the same oak tree; one eats acorns, and the other eats insects in the bark.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
